fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

Currently, when a customer creates a new issue via the Service Desk portal, the knowledge base can be integrated, to showcase articles relevant to the customer's query using keywords.

Similarly, it would be a great addition of a feature, to be able to search similar issues or past issues and generate a list to which a customer can open and go through the solution steps given by the Service Desk agent.

 
h3. *Why This is Important*

This would help in decreasing the number of tickets created with an answer already made available to other customers. Similar issues can be a great reference and self-learning point for the customers. Added with the knowledge base, it increases the ability to self-serve.

At the same time, if the customer already had raised this ticket before in the past, it would be a great reminder for them and they can check their past tickets to resolve the issue themselves.
fields.summary: The Ability to have Similar Issues Pop Up When Creating New Issue.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Email processing logs when viewed from within the project report error "Fetch call failed with status code: 401" when you do not have enough permission. 
 We need to provide a descriptive error here to help customers understand why they cannot view the email processing logs
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a service desk project, Add yourself to the *Service Desk Team* role But do not provide *Administer Project* permission
 # Go to Project > Project Settings > *Email Request*
 # Click on *View logs* to view the *Processing logs* for one of the mail handlers

h3. Expected Results

The following error should be reported:
{noformat}
You do not have permission to view this log. If the log is associated with a project, only the project admin can view it. If its not associated with a project, only the JIRA admin can view the log.
{noformat}
!expected.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The following error is reported
{noformat}
Fetch call failed with status code: 401
{noformat}
!Actual.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

When viewing the Email processing logs from Jira Settings > Products > *Email request* section it reports the correct error that you do ot have enough permissions.
fields.summary: Email processing logs when viewed from within the project report error "Fetch call failed with status code: 401" when you do not have enough permission

fields.description: I have jira services desk and jira software and I have a client with whom I need to share my platform so that that client is my first level of services and we are the second level and I develop the third level, how can I do it so that I can only give access to that See the project and the incidents or requests for requirements that they capture? .... Can it be done? ... Greetings and thanks.
fields.summary: level services

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the REST API only allows creating new customers.
[https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/#api-customer-post]
h3. Suggested Solution

Create a REST API to revoke portal only customers' access
h3. Why this is important

If you have multiple users to revoke, doing it using REST API will be faster and less expensive than having to edit all customers one by one through the UI
h3. Workaround

Edit on the UI
fields.summary: Ability to revoke portal only customers access via REST API

fields.description:
In customer notifications, you can change the style of request-related and custom notifications by customizing templates.

Templates are currently not applied to account type notifications.
h3. Suggested solution

Apply the templates for all customer notifications so you can customize the style of the "Customer invited" notification.
fields.summary: Apply template customizations to account type notifications

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The SLA average age report would display the time in fractions, eg: 0.43h which converts to 25 mins.
h3. Suggested Solution
Display the actual time as in 25 mins instead of the fraction of the hour for easier understanding
fields.summary: Ability to display the actual time in SLA average report

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in the new issue view, the Internal Notes is highlighted by a pale yellow which is hard to differentiate with Customer Responses.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to select the color of the Internal Note background

h3. Why this is important
This gives the option for users to select a background which best suits them.
fields.summary: Ability to change the background color for Internal Note

fields.description: It would be nice if when creating an issue via portal or email, a user could receive an email with a linked Confluence article that may help with that request.
fields.summary: Automatically respond with helpful article

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion

It'd be useful to have a more detailed view report Knowledge Base viewers, such as how many unique users accessed each KB article
fields.summary: Provide more detailed KB reports for Jira Service Desk projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement

Lack of "Resolution" value in JSD next gen is causing how issues appear in queue. If there is no resolution value set to the issues in a next gen sd project how would Jira recognize these issues as resolved? This affects how these issues appear in filters, the strike through of the resolved issues, etc.

More specifically:
 # "Resolved" tickets still appear on open on customer portal.
 #  Issues do not have a Resovled date so the "Resolved" column on the queue is always empty.

 
h3. Proposed Solution

Allow adding value to the "Resolution" field on JSD next gen issues.
fields.summary: Allow adding value to the "Resolution" field on JSD next gen issues.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

We want to add the name of the agent assigned to the issue (Assignee) in the customer notification template.

We have not located the variable, as we can add this variable to the template of client notifications.

h3. Suggested resolution

Provide the assignee variable in the customer notification variables. Like ${issue.assignee.name}
fields.summary: Add the name of the agent assigned to the issue (Assignee) in the customer notification template

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement

Agents are able to add customers on the "Customer" page, but there is no option available there to remove customers from the "Customer" page. Only a site admin is able to remove a customer from the site entirely. This means that the customer cannot be removed from a single JSD project. 


h3. Proposed solution

Provide the option for agents to remove customer directly from the project without admin rights needed. Agents should be able to remove customers from a project without have to remove request a site admin to remove the customer entirely from the site through User Management.
fields.summary: Allow service desk agents the ability to remove customers from a specific project without admin rights

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In anonymous portal, if the Jira system language is set to, for example, Danish, German, Portuguese, Spanish, the customers will see the portal in system language (the login page/portal text is in system language) despite having the project's default support language set to English and the customer's browser language set to any other language.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the project and set English as the default language support and add Danish/Portuguese/German/Spanish as a language visible to customer.
 # Go to Jira settings and set system language to Danish/Portuguese/German/Spanish.
 # Go to the browser settings and change browser language setting to French or any other language other than English.
 # Make sure to clear browser cache and cookies,
 # Open Incognito browsing mode and go to the portal.

h3. Expected Results

The customer portal login page should be showing as English(UK) since the default support language of the project is set to English(UK), while the other portal elements/text should be following the browser languages of the user.

For example - if the user's browser language is set to French:
 * Request types should be in English(UK)
 * Portal elements such as login page, uneditable text elements should be in French.

h3. Actual Results

The login page is showing as Danish/Portuguese/German/Spanish even though the default support language of the project is set to English(UK). So the Jira system language is overriding the default support language and browser language.

For example - if the user's browser language is set to French:
 * Request types is showing as Danish
 * Portal elements such as login page, uneditable text elements is also showing in Danish.

h3. Workaround
 * Change the Jira system language to English(UK) and set Jira user profile to Danish/Portuguese/German/Spanish instead if the users want Jira to be in Danish/Portuguese/German/Spanish.
fields.summary: Jira system language overrides default support language and browser language

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Some attachments fail to load in the new request view in the customer portal if the the request in question has more that 18 attachments.

h3. Environment
JSD Cloud - Nee request view in the customer portal

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JSD project via the customer portal. 
# Add over 18 attachments.
# Reload the request in the customer portal

h3. Expected Results
All attachments should load and be accessible.

h3. Actual Results
Some image fail to load with a grey box stating _Failed to load_
  !Error.png|thumbnail! 
{noformat}
{"error":{"code":"JwtAuthoriser:AuthorisationError","title":"The token does not allow requested operation. \"urn:filestore:file:<file_store_id>\" needs \"read\" permission","href":"https://api.media.atlassian.com#UnauthorizedError"}}
{noformat}
 
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When viewing requests via the new request view in the customer portal with more than 18 attachments some attachments fail to load.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Bug Fix Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
 At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
 You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Preset value of the assignee field doesn't work properly.
h3. Environment
 * Chrome Version 77.0.3865.90 (Official Build) (64-bit)
 * Firefox 69.0.1 (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Classic JSD project
 # Go to *Project settings* > *Request types*
 # Add a *assignee* field
 # Set a preset value to the assignee field
 # Click *Edit value* again and verify the value remains "Automatic"

  !Screenshot 2019-10-10 15.03.58.png|thumbnail!

Video: [https://youtu.be/wepgoLOiMFU]
h3. Expected Results

Project admin can add any assignable user to the preset.
h3. Actual Results

The preset value cannot be changed from "Automatic".
h3. Workaround

Add a component per request type and set a component lead as a default assignee if applicable.

 !Screenshot 2019-10-11 10.36.55.png|thumbnail!  !Screenshot 2019-10-11 10.38.00.png|thumbnail! 

Also consider adding yourself as a watcher to this ticket to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Project admin cannot specify a preset value to the assignee field

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

The new editor on the customer portal is awesome, but it’s placed on the bottom of the page which may not be a good experience for customers that has tickets with a lot of comments.
h3. *Suggested resolution*

Put the comment box back to the top of the tickets.
fields.summary: Move the comment box on the new customer portal to the top of the tickets

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Next-Gen Service Desk project
# Resolve a ticket
# Check the "Requests Resolved" report

h3. Expected Results
* The resolved ticket should appear either on the "Requests resolved without an article" series or on the "Requests resolved with an article" series

h3. Actual Results
* The resolved ticket is not shown on the report

h3. Notes
For classic projects, the resolution field is used for this report. It seems that the Next-Gen report uses the same principle, but there is no resolution field. The green status category should be used instead.

h3. Workaround
Use Classic projects.
fields.summary: The default "Requests Resolved" report does not work on Next-Gen projects

fields.description:
*We would like to be able to set automated comments for when a user is assigned to a Service Desk ''Get Help'' Ticket.*

 

Example:

Customer creates Get Help ticket

Set Alyda as Assignee

Automated Comment for customer: ''Alyda is now assigned to your ticket and will be in touch as soon as possible''
fields.summary: Automated Notificaton

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, in CSV issue export file , the "Request Participant" field exported as *Name (email address)* format. Admin can't use the same file to import the issue because it's only work with *email address/account ID* format. 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add user as request participant. (Make sure the email visibility is open to anyone)
# Perform CSV export

h3. Expected Results
"Request Participant" field comes with *Account ID* format.

h3. Actual Results
"Request Participant" field comes with *name (email address)*. 

h3. Notes
Due to this, admin can't use the same file to import. Admin must edit the field.

h3. Workaround
Create a ticket with support at [here|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/] asking for the CSV with email address and accountIDs
fields.summary: When issue CSV import , the "Request Participant" field imported with wrong format

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While adding a new custom email on your Service Desk project, after selecting the protocol the port number will be auto-completed, but the save button will remain grayed out. Manually changing the port number to the same of the auto-complete, brings the save button to be clickable again.

h3. Environment

Jira Service Desk > Email requests.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Service Desk project;
# Go to the email requests page and add a new custom email in the "other" option.
# Enter the email and password, hit next;
# Enter the mail server and select a protocol, the port will be auto-completed;
# Try to save.
** GIF reproducing: https://cl.ly/1a0f79c13439

h3. Expected Results

The port field is auto-completed and the user can save the email.

h3. Actual Results

The port field is auto-completed, but the save button remains grayed out.

h3. Workaround

Manually edit the port field to the same as auto-completed and save the custom email.
fields.summary: Not able to save custom email - save button grayed out

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+

Every Service Desk ticket has a Request Channel Type, or *Channel* as can be seen in the *Service Desk request* section on the View Issue screen.

This field can be used in JQLs e.g.:
{code:java}
request-channel-type is not EMPTY
{code}
(i) However it can't be exported to CSV (or any other export type).
h3. +Suggestion+

Since it's possible to export Customer Request Type and Satisfaction, it should be possible to export Request Channel Type as well, for reporting purposes.
fields.summary: Ability to export Request Channel Type

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the variables is only possible to be included into the notifications. It will be useful if the variables can be added to comments in agent view so the agents can use the available variables instead of copy-pasting text
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to use variables in comments
fields.summary: Ability to use variables in comments
Shareable links should be formatted or customizable to prompt users to log in

fields.description:
*Description*
Currently, the Service Desk "Requests Deflected" report is limited to its project's scope.

*Suggestion*
As a Jira Service Desk Administrator, it would be useful to have similar global report to have aggregated from all Service Desk projects (that have KB enabled) on the instance.
fields.summary: Add a global "Requests Deflected" report for Jira Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Customers are able to disable notification for their request but there are no indications for agents to know if a customer has disabled notification for that request. This causes misunderstanding between the agents and customers since the agents has replied but the customers are not receiving notifications. If the agents can know that the notifications were disabled, the customer can be contacted via other channels.

  !Screenshot.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability for agents to know whether the notifications are enabled/disabled.
fields.summary: Ability for agents to identify if customers has disabled notification on their requests

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When choosing a GIPHY from the new media pop-up and adding on an external comment for customers, the GIPHY is not rendered in the portal. But while uploading a .gif file to a comment, it does render.
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-04 at 12.55.25.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a ticket and using the new issue add a GIPHY to an external comment;
 # Check the ticket in the portal;

h3. Expected Results

The GIPHY is rendered and the customer can view it from the portal and the notification as well.
 GIF: [https://cl.ly/8f44d246de62]

Uploading a .gif file to the comment works.
 GIF: [https://cl.ly/8f44d246de62]
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-04 at 12.50.40.png|thumbnail!

It also works from the agent view.
 GIF: [https://cl.ly/99b975590425]
h3. Actual Results

The GIPHY doesn't render in the portal.
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-04 at 12.49.43.png|thumbnail!
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-04 at 12.50.21.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Download the GIF and upload it to the comment.
fields.summary: Unable to render GIPHY on portal
Changing the Assignee on an Automation rule or request type will display the assignee as "Automatic" even though there is a specific user selected.

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Implementation of New Features Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features.
You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Project admin cannot filter the users listed in [Raise this request on behalf of|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/raise-a-request-on-behalf-of-a-customer/].

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option to limit the users listed there like the user picker of the Custom Field.

 !Screenshot 2019-10-03 11.42.36.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Ability to set user filtering in "Raise this request on behalf of"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Adding a user picker field as a hidden field in a request type seems to not save the default value of the field when editing, but when creating a ticket the value is actually there.

h3. Environment

Jira Service Desk - Request types.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Add a user picker field to a request type;
# Set it to hidden and provide a default value;
# Edit the value.
** GIF reproducing: https://cl.ly/4b32afd9afa6

h3. Expected results

When clicking to edit the value, the existing added users should be shown.

h3. Actual result

The field seems to be empty.
GIF: https://cl.ly/4b32afd9afa6

h3. Notes

The values are actually there if you create a ticket.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Hidden user picker fields missing values on request types

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some attachments on JSD tickets are not loading for customers or agents when viewed in the new portal redesign. 

Confirmed attachments added by email to be affected, however it is possible more scenarios exist. 

h3. Environment
Cloud
New JSD portal redesign enabled. 
Noted in weekly blog - [Atlassian Cloud changes Sep 23 to Sep 30, 2019|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2019/09/atlassian-cloud-changes-sep-23-to-sep-30-2019#AtlassianCloudchangesSep23toSep30,2019-jira.service.desk]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSD project
 # Ensure new portal redesign enabled
 # Raise a ticket.
 # Email a reply to the ticket and include an image. 
 # View the ticket in the customer portal.

h3. Expected Results
The image included in the email response should display in the comments thread on the ticket in the customer portal. 

h3. Actual Results
 !image-2019-10-02-17-45-06-445.png|thumbnail! 

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
{"error":{"code":"JwtAuthoriser:AuthorisationError","title":"The token does not allow requested operation. \"urn:filestore:file:<file_store_id>\" needs \"read\" permission","href":"https://api.media.atlassian.com#UnauthorizedError"}}
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Some attachments are not displayed and cannot be downloaded via the customer portal with the new redesign view.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Opening a request created via email by clicking on the issue key/description the "My requests" page shows a "The request type you are trying to view does not exist." error screen, even when the request type exists.
h3. Environment

All
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a Customer to a project
 # Customer creates a request via email. The email request type is hidden from the portal
 # Agent opens the issue and moves it into 'In Progress > Resolved' status
 # Customer logs in the portal, clicks on Requests > All > All Statuses
 # Customer clicks on the ticket summary or the issue key of a Resolved ticket

h3. Expected Results

The customer can view the request.
h3. Actual Results

The customer is shown an error screen with a "The request type you are trying to view does not exist." error.
h3. Notes

This only affects tenants that have the following feature flag enabled: [https://hello.atlassian.net/browse/FD-6114]
h3. Workaround

When a customer refreshes the request details page with the error, the request is displayed successfully.
 When a customer rights clicks on the request summary or the issue key to open it in a new tab, the request opens successfully.
 When Customer clicks on 'View Request' from the email link, it opens successfully too.
fields.summary: Opening an email request from the my requests list shows an incorrect request type error

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when the project has a lot of customers, the pagination button will only display as below :-

{panel}
Prev 1 2 3 4 5 Next
{panel}

 !Screenshot 2019-10-02 at 9.21.34 PM.png|thumbnail! 

The number will change once the user go to the next page but still within five numbers. In case the user would like to go to the page where the last customer on the list, they need to keep on click the next page. It is best to have a *Last* button. This will expedite the process.

h3. Suggested Solution
It is best to have a *Last* button. 

h3. Why this is important
This will expedite the process.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Create "Last" button at Customer list pagination

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Currently, the approval section generated by Service Desk Approvals Plugin would not show the user avatars for the user who shows as a an approval on a service desk ticket. It would be beneficial to cover this area along with the GDPR effort in toggling the user avatar visibility from https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2019/07/profile-visibility-settings-are-now-available-on-atlassian-cloud
fields.summary: Ability to display user avatar from the approval section.

fields.description:
In Classic projects, user can use their setting using the "Create with Shared Configuration" function. However, currently this is not available for next-gen projects.
It would be great if next-gen projects have the ability to clone them.
It would also be great if this clone function includes copying the request types and customer settings
fields.summary: Ability to clone next-gen projects

fields.description:
Currently, only custom reports can be added to the "Service Desk reports" dashboard gadget.

*Suggestion* 
Allow the default JSD reports (e.g.: Satisfaction and "Requests deflected" reports) to be used on the "Service Desk reports" dashboard gadget.
fields.summary: Allow the default JSD reports to be used on the "Service Desk reports" dashboard gadget

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A Service Desk agent that is a Project Administrator can't include or edit a custom email account in the email requests. 

The project administrator is able to turn on and off the emails requests and edit the default account, however, the custom email is not editable and in case you're trying to add a new account the buttons are displayed, but, you can't click on it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Access Jira using a Project Administrator account.
# Go to the *Project Settings* > *Email Requests*.
# Try to click on the buttons to add a custom email account.
# The buttons will be available, however, they are not clickable.

h3. Expected Results

Since the Project Administrator is able to turn on and off the email requests and can edit the default address, it's expected that it should be possible to also edit and include custom accounts.

h3. Actual Results

Just the default email request is editable.

h3. Workaround

Include the agent as a Jira Administrator.
fields.summary: Project administrators can't include or edit a custom email account in the email requests.

fields.description:
h3. +Issue Summary+
When you upload two different images on ServiceDesk Customer portal using copy/paste option, it will upload the same image two times.

h3. +Environment+
* ServiceDesk


h3. +Steps to Reproduce+
# Go to my test ticket https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/42/PSCLOUD-36683
# Copy any image from your local system and paste it into the comment box in the ticket above.
# Copy another image and paste it the same way as the last step.
# After publishing the comment, you will see same image uploaded two times.

h3. +Expected Results+
It should show different images on the ticket after publishing the comment.

h3. +Actual Results+
It shows same images after publishing the comment even when the uploaded images were different.

h3. +Notes+
It works fine if you will use the browse option to upload images.

h3. +Workaround+
Use browse option instead of copy/paste for uploading images.
fields.summary: Uploading different images using copy/paste uploads the same image two times

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On the New Request View, if a comment contains an attachment in preformatted text markup, the request will fail to be displayed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As an Agent, add a .txt file to a JSD request.
# In a public comment, add the attachment markup surrounded by brackets
{noformat}{{[ˆfile.txt]}}{noformat}
# Check the request on the portal

h3. Expected Results

The issue can be viewed with no issues

h3. Actual Results

The following error appears

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Error in the browser console:
{code}
index.js:19 SyntaxError: Unexpected end of JSON input
    at JSON.parse (<anonymous>)
    at f (styled.tsx:24)
    at s (styled.tsx:24)
    at t.render (styled.tsx:24)
    at va (react-dom.production.min.js:173)
    at ma (react-dom.production.min.js:172)
    at Gs (react-dom.production.min.js:247)
    at Bs (react-dom.production.min.js:216)
    at Ls (react-dom.production.min.js:210)
    at Is (react-dom.production.min.js:206)
    at react-dom.production.min.js:114
    at t.unstable_runWithPriority (index.js:19)
    at co (react-dom.production.min.js:113)
    at ho (react-dom.production.min.js:114)
    at fo (react-dom.production.min.js:113)
    at js (react-dom.production.min.js:204)
    at Object.enqueueSetState (react-dom.production.min.js:127)
    at n.x.setState (react.production.min.js:13)
    at t (index.js:205)
    at index.js:215
{code}
 
h3. Notes

- The error can be replicated with any other file type.

h3.Workaround

- Do not use the preformatted markup on attachments.
fields.summary: Surrounding an attachment markup in double brackets (preformatted text markup) will break the portal issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Audit log didn't include for "Customer Notification" changes. There's no way to track who update the configuration.

h3. Suggested Solution
Include "Customer Notification" changes in Audit log

h3. Why this is important
Sometimes the feature enabled or disable unintendedly. It's best to have information on how update it.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Audit log for Customer Notification configuration

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using Edge, navigate to a classic Service Desk project
# Click "Report" > "New report"
# Click "Add series"

h3. Expected Results
The modal window to add the series opens

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens. The following error is found in the console
{code}
0: Unable to get property '0' of undefined or null reference
{code}

h3. Workaround
Use other browsers
fields.summary: Clicking "Add series" does not open the modal when using Edge browser

fields.description:
Currently, the maximum number of days to set in the automation rule *Time in Status* is 30 days. Setting up more than 30 days gives a validation message.

It would be handy to set the number of days greater than 30 days.

 !Screen Shot 2019-09-30 at 4.10.07 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to have more than 30 days in automation rule - Time in status

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

In the *Automation* page of the a Service Desk project, After clicking on the "Configuration" button to change or set the user for the "Run as User" option, the drop down shows "No Option".

!automation.png|width=386,height=201!

This is misleading as there is no indication that there are other users that can be set as here. There is also no text that says something like "Type here to generate list of users"

*Suggested Idea*

It would be great if a text is listed such as "Please type to list down users" or when you click on the field, it automatically generates the list of users that can be included within this field.
fields.summary: Add text to Automation "Run As User" to type to generate user list.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

In the old portal view, the latest comment was placed in the upper part of the page, so it was easy to find the latest comment with a tag on it. In the new portal design, the latest comment is placed at the end of the page along with the comment box, like it is from inside Jira.

h3. Suggested resolution

Ability to choose which order the comments will have in the portal view.
fields.summary: Ability to change comment order in the new portal design

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Open Service Desk project's customer page can be slow to load


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Allow the global service desk configuration to allow users to be able to sign-up to the help center
# Create a service desk project with customer permission set to *Anyone can send a request* 
# If the instance now has multiple customers, navigate to the Project > *Customer* page
# Go through the first 3-4 pages of customers page

h3. Expected Results
The Customers page loads within a few seconds and going to next pages should not take a lot of time

h3. Actual Results
The customer page is slow to load. Once the customer page loads, it takes additional time for customers to actually appear on the customer page. The same behavior happens when you click on the next page. 
 

h3.Workaround
Once the customer page loads, Instead of going through the next Customer pages looking for a customer, we can search for the customer using the search button
fields.summary: Open Service Desk project's customer page can be slow to load

fields.description:
*This is specifically for Jira Service Desk Cloud.*

Customer would like to modify the email headers for Jira service desk cloud. 

Example: Delete Reply-To: header or change it to match with From: header.
fields.summary: Would like to delete Reply-To: header or change it to match with From: header.

fields.description:
Currently, it is possible to flag an issue in a JSD project if it is in a Board, but not possible if viewing the specific issue.

It would be nice to be able to click on *...* and *Add flag* or *Remove flag* (if a flag is already set) while viewing an issue in a JSD project.
fields.summary: Have the ability to "Add Flag" and "Remove Flag" from "..." menu

fields.description:
On classic projects, we can use any request type for email channel, it's necessary only to let summary and description as required as we already know and it's also possible to use different request types for each email address if we add a custom one.

When we create a next-gen project, it has a default request type and we can't change. Also if we add a custom email address, we can't associate with a different one.

It would be great if we could change the request type, because the same as classic ones, sometimes we need simple requests to be created by email and also the portal.
fields.summary: Ability to change the issue type/request type for email channel when using next-gen projects

fields.description:
Good afternoon Atlassian Team,

I support the cssjira.atlassian.net instance and we have been given notice by users that the below issue is very common.

When we have users attempt to login to access a portal for a Jira Service Desk project, they sometimes have issues attempting to login with an incorrect password. This prompts them to attempt to reset it, where they receive the following message (please note the email address displayed is being used as an example):

_"A reset password link has been sent to_ _[test1234@gmail.com|mailto:xxx@gmail.com]_

_Follow the link to select a new password."_

This message displays for users who attempt to access our Service Desk portals that have an account with us, +*and*+ for those do not exist in our user administration as a user of the Jira instance or portal-only customer, with the latter being a common occurrence within our user base.

For those users that have no record of an account in our instance, the portal should display a message saying they need to create an account rather than misleading them into thinking a password reset email is being sent to their inbox.
fields.summary: Messaging to indicate to user no account exists when attempting to reset password

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, from the Customer Portal, the knowledge base tab will also display the first part of the body content of the knowledge base. Refer the screenshot below :-

 !Screenshot 2019-09-25 at 11.49.04 PM.png|thumbnail! 

View from Confluence:-
 !Screenshot 2019-09-25 at 11.57.16 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Remove the body content from the tab as sometimes it's not relevant and customer will able to see the whole content when opening the knowledge-based page. 

h3. Why this is important
It will make better visibility to the customer.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Remove Knowledge base body content from the Knowledge Base tab at Customer Portal

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

In the Service Desk queue section, users have the ability to inline edit the "Assignee" field and "Status" field only. This is very helpful to make quick decisions and saved the users a few steps. 

*Suggested Idea*

It would be great if more fields can be edited in the queue page. I would like to request to add the ability to inline edit more fields such as custom fields, "reporter" value and label values.

*Documentation*

- [Update Workflow Status from your queue|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/update-workflow-status-from-your-queue/]
- [Assign Requests from your queue|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/assign-requests-from-your-queue/]
- [4 Changes to Queues and Issues you don't want to miss|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Desk-articles/4-changes-to-queues-and-issues-you-don-t-want-to-miss/ba-p/1078440]
fields.summary: Add More Options to Inline Edit Function in Queue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4272].
{panel}
h3. Summary

When attempting to migrate from JIRA Server 7.2.X running JIRA Service Desk 3.2.X, the import process fails displaying an error that indicates JIRA Service Desk should first be upgraded before being imported into Cloud.
h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud - v1000.319.1
JIRA Service Desk - v3.3.0-OD-1000.335.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ensure your JIRA Server install is running JIRA 7.2.0 or later
 # Ensure you have installed JIRA Service Desk 3.2.0 or later from the Atlassian Marketplace
 # Run a full export of your JIRA Server install
 # Attempt to import this into JIRA Cloud

h3. Expected Results

The External System Import process should complete without error
h3. Actual Results

The External System Import process fails and displays the following error:
{noformat}
"We can't complete your upgrade. It looks like the data you are trying to import is from an earlier version of JIRA Service Desk. You need to upgrade to JIRA Service Desk 3.0 first, then export new data and try again. Read these upgrade notes for instructions: http://confluence.atlassian.com/migration/jira-7/server_jira+jsd_upgrade"

{noformat}
h3. Notes

!importfailure.png|thumbnail!

Searching in the entities.xml file, you will see that the version of Service Desk running has not been completely upgraded:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.activeobjects.admin.ActiveObjectsPluginToTablesMapping : {"AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFIELDVALUE":{"key":"com.atlassian.servicedesk","name":"JIRA Service Desk","version":"2.3.6","vendorName":"Atlassian","vendorUrl":"http://www.atlassian.com"},"AO_54307E_QUEUECOLUMN":{"key":"com.atlassian.servicedesk","name":"JIRA Service Desk","version":"2.3.6","vendorName":"Atlassian","vendorUrl":"http://www.atlassian.com"}

{noformat}
This is caused by the customer most likely installed at some point the JIRA Service Desk plugin jar (even though it was not licensed) OR [Skipping major versions |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Skipping+major+versions+when+upgrading+JIRA+applicationsl]
h3. Workaround

The JIRA Server install must be downgraded in order to resolve this issue
 # Setup a temporary install of JIRA Server 7.1.9 and [connect to a new database |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Connecting+JIRA+applications+to+a+database]
 # Create an XML backup of JIRA Server
 ** import this backup into the 7.1.9 Server.
 ** When running the import, JIRA will confirm that you want to downgrade your data
 # Once your JIRA 7.1.9 Server is running with your 7.2 data you can proceed to install JIRA Service Desk 3.1.9 [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.servicedesk.application/versions]]
 ** Make sure a license is added. You can generate an evaluation license by going to my.atlassian.com.
 ** To apply this license, you will want to go here: JIRA Administration > Applications > Versions & Licenses
 # Once the installation is complete and you have added the license, refresh the Versions & Licenses page
 ** Confirm that you see the Service Desk options on the left side. This will confirm that Service Desk loaded.
 # Create an XML backup of your JIRA 7.1.9 Server
 # Import this backup into your JIRA Cloud instance

h3. *New workaround*:

Removing the Service Desk Upgrade History entries of type *6* from the entities.xml file allow the import to go through as well.
The entries are like the ones below:
{noformat}
 <OSPropertyEntry id="22441" entityName="com.atlassian.servicedesk:Upgrade.History" entityId="1" propertyKey="2015-06-09T01:05:46.639+02:00" type="6"/>
 <OSPropertyEntry id="22442" entityName="com.atlassian.servicedesk:Upgrade.History" entityId="2" propertyKey="2015-06-09T01:05:48.545+02:00" type="6"/>
 [...]
{noformat}
We can then remove these entries running the following command:
{code:java}
sed -i '/<OSPropertyEntry.*com.atlassian.servicedesk.*type="6"/d' entities.xml
{code}
After that, just zip the files back and run the import.


If Jira Service Desk was in the evaluation years ago and you're good to lose all data on JSD, you could also apply the steps here:
* [Import to Jira Cloud failed due to unable to complete the upgrade on Jira Service Desk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/import-to-jira-cloud-failed-due-to-unable-to-complete-the-upgrade-on-jira-service-desk-967891526.html]

h4. Note:
If you're using Mac and encounter the following error when running the command:
{code}
error sed: 1: “entities.xml”: invalid command code e
{code}

This is because {{-i}} flag has a mandatory suffix, as described [here|https://markhneedham.com/blog/2011/01/14/sed-sed-1-invalid-command-code-r-on-mac-os-x/]. Whereas, the suffix is optional on Ubuntu. So, please use this command for the workaround:
{code}
sed -i "" '/<OSPropertyEntry.*com.atlassian.servicedesk.*type="6"/d' entities.xml
{code}
fields.summary: Importing JIRA Service Desk Server site export into JIRA Cloud fails with version error

fields.description: Similiar to within Jira Software next-gen, we would like to have the ability to configure the fields that appear in Jira Service Desk next-gen issues: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/configure-field-layout-in-the-issue-view-961798059.html].
fields.summary: Ability to configure issue layout for Jira Service Desk issues

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of July 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Microsoft has not released any major updates for IE11 since 2015, and has [recently discouraged the use of IE11 as a default browser|https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Windows-IT-Pro-Blog/The-perils-of-using-Internet-Explorer-as-your-default-browser/ba-p/331732].

To allow us to continue to take advantage of modern web standards to deliver improved functionality and the best possible user experience across all of our products, we have ended support for IE11 on *31 March 2020*.

End of support means we will not fix bugs that are specific to IE11, and will begin to introduce features that aren't compatible with this browser.

Find out more about this change from our [announcement|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Feedback-Forum-articles/Retiring-IE11-support-for-Atlassian-cloud-server-and-data-center/ba-p/1185312].

If you have questions or concerns about this change, please comment on this issue.
{panel}
fields.summary: Plans to end support for IE11

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In a JSD next gen project, removing options from a drop down field on one of the request types and saving changes does not apply change after page is refreshed. The removed options return again.
h3. Environment

JSD next gen project
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a JSD next project > Project Settings > Request types
 # On one of the request types, create a "Drop down" field
 # Name the field and add a few options
 # Save Changes
 # Click on the created drop down field, remove 1 or 2 of the options
 # Save Changes
 # Click on the drop down field again

h3. Expected Results

The options removed from the drop down field should no longer appear after "Save Changes"
h3. Actual Results

The options reappear again once more in the drop down field options but in different order.

 
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Removing "options" from a drop down field on a request type in JSD next gen does not save

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a comment text contains “!” and then another “!” on a later line in the comment, the comment fails to be created without letting the user know of the reason why it failed

h3. Environment
All browsers.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Type a comment containing a "!" and an other "!" on a later line
# Submit the comment

h3. Expected Results
The comment is submitted and attached on the ticket as expected.

h3. Actual Results
The comment is submitted and attached on the ticket as expected fails to be submitted.

h3. Notes
* The new request details view is part of a progressive rollout visible on https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2019/09/atlassian-cloud-changes-sep-9-to-sep-16-2019#AtlassianCloudchangesSep9toSep16,2019-jira.service.desk
* The new request details view is currently disabled for all customers due to this bug. When fix, we will restart its progressive rollout

h3. Workaround
N/A (as the new request details view is not enabled in production)
fields.summary: On the new Help Center request details view, a comment text that contains “!” and then another “!” on a later line will fail to be submitted

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if you would like to set a field to be required in team-managed (formerly next-gen) JSD project, the field need to drag under "Customer Portal Fields" and the required option will be displayed. The downside is , the field will be displayed in the portal. Admin only wants to set it as required when raising it from JIRA.

h3. Suggested Solution
Able to set internal field to required.

h3. Why this is important
Give options to the administrator to set the field to required when creating an issue from JIRA.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Ability to set "Internal Fields" to be required in team-managed (formerly next-gen) project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When adding comments in the customer portal, customers are able to upload attachments by drag/drop, paste screenshot or browse attachments on their computer. However, there are no possibilities to disable this module to prevent customers from uploading attachments in the customer portal instead of an internal attachment app.
h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to disable uploading attachments when commenting.
fields.summary: Ability to disable uploading attachments on comments

fields.description:
Currently, we can add a default text for fields and also use the Field Help to add instruction for customers to fill the form in the customer portal.

It would be great if we could add placeholder and also some instruction when the customer hovers the mouse over custom fields in the customer portal and widget.
fields.summary: Ability to add placeholder and hover text for fields in the customer portal and widget

fields.description: All the defects and tests we have in the Jira project are missing totally. Please treat this urgent.
fields.summary: URGENT : All the Defects and Test in the JIRA Project are missing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
*Alert user* in automation rules show invalid module although the actual mention still works
h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a Alert user in the _Then do this..._ condition

h3. Expected Results
The rule would show the selected user would be alerted
h3. Actual Results
The rule shows an invalid module



h3. Notes
The alert still works but shows invalid in the rule config and also in the logs

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Alert user in automation rules show invalid module

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 *
 *
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to service desk project settings -> Automation
 # Create/Edit a rule and add alert user then action

h3. Expected Results
Add alert user then action should work

h3. Actual Results
Got an error on the alert user then action webform saying "Invalid module: com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.automation.servicedesk-automation-modules-plugin:alert-user-action"


h3. Workaround
There is no workaround. Fix is merged and will be roll out to production in the next release
fields.summary: Service Desk alert user then action failed with invalid module com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.automation.servicedesk-automation-modules-plugin:alert-user-action

fields.description:
As a Jira agent, I want a way to avoid duplicate issues created by a monitor that checks for failures periodically, so that we don't need to waste time and cycle in linking and closing duplicate issues and focus on resolution. 

 

Acceptance Criteria
 * A configuration for "New issues with Summary matching existing issue"
 ** The scope should be Project
 ** The configuration should provide the options
 *** Ignore: The JSD system takes no action on the new issue and discards it. 
 *** Comment: The JSD system takes the new issue and updates the existing issue with a new comment. 
 * An option to ignore certain strings like "RE:", "FWD", "ID###", "PROD", "DEV", etc.
 ** This is so the Summary "ID123: system1 down" and "ID246: system1 down" can be considered the same issue, if the user chooses to.
 * This should only apply to new issues created via inbound email or REST API.  Issues created via the portal should not be affected.
fields.summary: Avoid Duplicate Issues With Same Summary Field

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When the agent posts a comment from inside Jira, the customer portal does not show the comment until the customer reloads the page.

h3. Suggested resolution

Reloads the customer portal page every time an agent posts an external comment from inside Jira.
fields.summary: Reload customer portal when agent posts a comment

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set your profile's timezone to Santiago (GMT-4)
 # Go to the *Created vs Resolved* Service Desk report, select *Custom dates* and set *Sep/08* as start or end date.

h3. Expected Results

The report is rendered accordingly.

h3. Actual Results

The page will keep refreshing and the following error will appear.

 !image-2019-09-17-18-04-27-346.png|thumbnail! 

{code}
{"errors":[{"errorMessage":"Unsupported date format, make sure the date you entered is in the format yyyy-MM-dd"}],"reasonKey":"sd.project.reports.customdate.invalid.time.format","reasonCode":"400"}
{code}
h3. Notes

This issue is probably related to the Chilean Daylight Saving Time
- https://www.timeanddate.com/time/change/chile/santiago?year=2019

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JSD Report keeps refreshing when selecting September 8th start or end date

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While viewing the Jira Service Desk CSAT notification in Outlook for Windows, the hyperlink to activate the rating is only "clickable" on the left side of the star. Clicking on the right side of the star will not set the CSAT score.

h3. Environment

* Office 365 Outlook  
* Windows 10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Trigger a CSAT notification by resolving a JSD request.
# Mouse over the CSAT rating star.

h3. Expected Results

The hyperlink to set the rating is active on the whole star.

h3. Actual Results

The hyperlink to set the rating is active only on the left side of the star.
 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

This issue doesn't affect OWA (Outlook Web App) or Outlook for macOS.

h3. Workaround

- Clicking on the left side of the star.
- Opening the CSAT in OWA.
fields.summary: CSAT hyperlink bugged on Outlook for windows

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The JSD Help Center is unavailable for European and US regions.
h3. Workaround

None.

Atlassian engineers are currently working on a fix. Will keep this updated.
fields.summary: Jira service desk help center is unavailable for some regions

fields.description:
h3. Environment

* Jira Service Desk subscription;
* Service Desk project with Customer Permissions set to allow anyone with access to the instance to have access as customer
* Service Desk Global Settings set to *not* allow _customers_ to sign-up
** In this case, the users will be logging in with Atlassian Accounts

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add your company's domain to allow self sign-up on Site Access settings
# Toggle off all "New users have access to this product" option on Product Access settings
#* This is for any new accounts to be considered customers on Service Desk projects
# Use the self sign-up option


h3. Expected Results

The user is redirected to the Help Center home for Service Desk portals

h3. Actual Results
An "Operation is taking too long" error is shown, even though the account was successfully created.

h3. Workaround
Refresh the page after a while to be redirected to the portal.
fields.summary: Atlassian Accounts created with no Application Access on Jira Service Desk instances are shown an "Operation taking too long" error during self sign-up

fields.description:
Currently, when an issue's Issue Type is changed, it's Request Type is cleared.

Suggestion:

Either have a default Request Type based on the Issue Type so it's not necessary to manually add a Request Type after the Issue Type is changed, or have a way to set default fields that would be valid for issues with no Request Type.
fields.summary: Allow Issue Types to have a "default" Request Type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary:

Service Desk team role is not being honoured while granting "Edit issue" permission in a Service Desk project.
 The user is added to service desk team role and this role has Edit issue permission however, the permission does not work.

Hence the users are unable to Edit the Issues in Old issue view

And Assign the issues to other team members in the New Issue View.

Issue occurs to multiple users.
h3. Environment

JSD Cloud
h3. Expected Results

Permission granted to "Service Desk Team" should allow the user to Edit issue as he is part of this role
h3. Actual Results

Users in Service Desk team role are unable to edit issue

 
h3. Workaround

Add users separately to the permission or give the access to the group of which users are a member
fields.summary: Service Desk team role is not being honoured while granting "Edit issue" permission in a Service Desk project.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when JIRA user with application access ( without JIRA Service Desk) have "Browse Project" permission, it will automatically be added as Customer. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Don't include the user part of the project Customer.

h3. Why this is important
Admin only wants to allow them to view the issue from JIRA, but not to create issue via Customer Portal.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA licensed user (without JIRA Service Desk) have "Browse Project" permission without being added as project Customer

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding holidays in SLA calendar for next-gen SD project causes the page to reload. Changes are lost.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a next-gen SD project.
# Go to SLA -> Calendar 
# Edit the Calendar -> Enter details
# Click *Add* button

h3. Expected Results
Holidays should be added to the calendar.

h3. Actual Results
Browser page reload popup shows up.

h3. Notes
Reproducible only in Next-gen SD projects.
 !Screen Shot 2019-09-16 at 11.33.08 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Can not add holidays in SLA calendar for next-gen project

fields.description:
Currently, customer notifications from the project settings can only be enabled or disabled. There is no way to delete a notification.

If many notifications are created then there is no way to clean-up the clutter. Ideally, both built-in and custom ones should be removable.
fields.summary: Ability to delete customer notifications from project settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Environment

Jira service desk cloud mail handler
h3. Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a ticket by sending an email to the JSD mail handler and attach an image as inline in the description of the issue
h3.  
h3. Expected Results:

Image get attached as an inline image in the description

 
h3. Actual Results

Image does not get attached as an inline, rather it comes as a separate attachment

!Screen Shot 2019-08-31 at 9.23.29 PM.png|width=451,height=262!

 

 Notes

This issue is specific to request created by some mail clients:
 - Kopano

 - Apple Mail Client on the iPhone

h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Inline images attached to requests created by apple mail client (iphone) come as separate attachments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customers acting as Reporters are receiving Jira notifications despite Service Desk Notification configuration being set to only receive Service Desk notifications
h3. Environment

Jira Service Desk Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a Customer to a Service Desk project
 # Set the Notifications configuration on https://<instance_name>secure/admin/SDConfiguration.jspa to only receive Service Desk notifications
 # Have the customer create an issue
 # They will receive Jira Notifications such as when issue is created, resolved, closed if those events include the Reporter in the project's Notification scheme

h3. Expected Results

Given that Reporters are always treated as Customers regardless of their role, they should only be getting Customers notifications and not Service Desk notifications (as long as the Jira Service Desk Notifications configuration is set as such)
h3. Actual Results

Jira Service Desk is ignoring the Notifications Configuration for this role 
h3. Workaround

1. Remove the Reporter from the respective notification event OR create a custom event with no Reporter in the notification

2. Edit the affected workflow transition to include a post-function which fires the event from step 1 or set it to trigger the custom event created
fields.summary: Customers acting as Reporters are receiving Jira notifications despite Service Desk Notification configuration set to only receive Service Desk notifications

fields.description:
I find that the current Requests Details User Interface in the Customer Portal unfriendly:

In the request details, the Information Details display fields such as the Description is placed at the bottom of the screen, as the Details log is placed under the Activity logs.

As the information in the Activity logs propagate, the Request Details become longer, and as a result, the Request Information Details are pushed to the bottom of the screen, resulting in the customer to scroll down to the bottom of the screen to understand the Request Details.

This is unfavorable to the customers using this interface, particularly to the approvers who need to review the Request Details before Approving/Declining the Request.

Couldn't the Request Information Details be placed on the top of the screen before Activity logs instead?
fields.summary: Customer Portal Request Information Details to place on the top of the screen instead of Activity Logs

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Not able to manually sort next-gen service desk issues on a classic software board while sorting works for software next-gen projects

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a classic kanban board 
# Include issues from a next-gen software and a next-gen service desk project and map them to a column on the board
# Make sure that you order your board filter by Rank in order to allow the manual sort of issues in the board

h3. Expected Results
Manual sort works for all issues on the board

h3. Actual Results
Manual sort works for the issues from a next-gen software project. 
However, for issues from service desk next-gen project, once you sort the issues, after reloading the board the changes to the sort order are reverted
fields.summary: Not able to manually sort next-gen service desk issues on a classic software board

fields.description:
Hello,

Within my workflow I have the Test and Development states I need to know how many times the Isssue passes through that state.

Summary:
I need a counter between workflow transactions

Can someone please help me
fields.summary: Counter between transitions of 2 states in workflow

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Links from issue view within Reports context should transition the page to the issue but doesn't
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # View an issue from a custom report via the drilldown
 # Link the issue to an existing one
 # Click on the link to the issue from the links table

h3. Expected Results

Page transitions to the issue.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Clicking on issue links in issue view within report does not work

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Not able to edit/disconnect custom JSD mail handler.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure to have either a default JSD Cloud mail handler and a Custom one.
# Then go the email requests(INSTANCE_URL/secure/admin/SDMailInfo.jspa)
# Delete the Default Cloud email
# Access the JSD project settings > Email Requests

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to edit the configuration or disconnect the email channel.

h3. Actual Results
The buttons are grayed out and we can neither change the configuration nor delete the mail handler.
 
h3. Workaround
* Go to the JSD project settings > Email Requests and then disable the email channel and re-enable it once again.
fields.summary: Not able to edit/disconnect JSD mail handler

fields.description:
Requirement:

 

It would be nice to have a checkbox so that users can select and delete issue directly from a JSD queue
fields.summary: Delete issues directly from Queue

fields.description:
Servicedesk API is lacking crucial functionality which prevents us from fully integrating its functionality within our corporate portals. 

Creating a request through API can already be done on behalf of a user (raiseOnBehalfOf). Commenting however does not have this option, therefore comments will always be made on behalf of the API user account.

Although there are workarounds, such as replacing the API account's display name with our authenticated customer's user name within our own portal UI, there appears to be no workaround to prevent support tickets from transitioning from 'Waiting for support' to 'Waiting for customer', or the fact that tickets would essentially always remain in 'Waiting for customer' status. 

There used to be a workaround of taking the generated Atlassian customer account and changing the password to some internally known password, and using those credentials to post the comment, however changing other account's passwords has been deprecated a long time ago.

By adding commentOnBehalfOf you have the opportunity to fix a crucial oversight in the Servicedesk API's use case scenario's and allowing for tight integrations. This would bring Atlassian's Servicedesk on par with competitor products.
fields.summary: API: POST comment has no commentOnBehalfOf

fields.description:
We have embedded the JSD-widget. But the browser console is spitting out warnings and lowers the CSP-compliance level of our site.

=> It would be great if you could have a look and improve the CSP-compliance.

!image-2019-09-10-09-06-56-396.png!
{noformat}
mbed.ts:40 Refused to execute inline script because it violates the following Content Security Policy directive: "script-src 'self' 'nonce-ck0c4o54800000tmo357heu62' 
[https://jsd-widget.atlassian.com|https://jsd-widget.atlassian.com/]
". Either the 'unsafe-inline' keyword, a hash ('sha256-unawk8oxMjxPG04UXJudRjZPb/aQ/CshgfawzK+tomg='), or a nonce ('nonce-...') is required to enable inline execution.
{noformat}
fields.summary: JSD - widget violates CSP-policies

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a service desk project
 # Install some addons, for example  Slake integration, Scheduler Access Management, Scheduler Notifications, Scheduler Project Calenders, Development tools
# Go to project as admin and click "Invite Team"
# In the dialog enter an email and press enter 

h3. Expected Results
The dialog will show the number of Service Desk agent license have been used on the tenant, this number should match the number of agent license when you check project access under user management

h3. Actual Results
The two numbers mismatch, with the number shown on invite team dialog bigger because it counted add-on users as well

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. Customer is charged with correct agent license number from user management so there is no financial loss for them.
fields.summary: Addon users shouldn't be counted as licensed Service Desk users on invite team dialog

fields.description: Currently, when we create an issue using Automation on Service Desk, we need to select a priority for this ticket. It would be great if it had a checkbox to use the same priority as the original ticket.
fields.summary: Ability to inherit priority from SD when creating a ticket using automation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it is not possible to limit signups to accounts with specific email domain(s).

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the ability to limit signups to accounts with specific email domain(s).
fields.summary: Ability to limit customer signups to specific email domain(s)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Logged  in as an Atlassian account and with profile visibility set to organisation. When viewing any page in the Help Center except for profile my avatar is not displayed correctly. It shows my initials instead.
h3. Environment

Atlassian Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Reproduced on [https://sd-flux-capacitors.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portals]
 # Login as an Atlassian Account
 # Ensure your profile has an avatar configured and also who can see your profile photo set to Organisation (Profile -> Manage Your Account  -> Wait 5 minutes)
 # *Reload* any page except for profile page and you will see your initials in the top right instead of your avatar.
 !Screen Shot 2019-09-05 at 2.03.33 pm.png|width=619,height=259!

h3. Expected Results

User is able to see their configured avatar.
h3. Actual Results

User is sees their initials where avatar should be
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Atlassian Account - Help Center doesn't show my avatar correctly when visibility set to Organisation

fields.description:
Currently JSD projects don't have an option to Customize the Issue Layout in New Issue View

 

This is need for various customers so that they can decide the placements of various fields and how they will be displayed in the Issue View.
fields.summary: Ability to customize issue layout in New Issue view for Service Desk Projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The SLA sorting is incorrect.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a few tickets with different SLA settings.
# Create a JSD queue and order by one of the SLAs. For example, Time to resolution

h3. Expected Results

The Queue will be ordered by the "Time to resolution" remaining time.

h3. Actual Results

The queue will not display issues in the correct order.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Changing the sort order will have no effect:

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

The same issue occurs in the "Issue Navigator".
 
h3. Workaround
Workaround for customers who are affected by this is: reupdate their SLA Goals with the same value.
fields.summary: "Order by" SLA field is broken

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, JSD treated one email for one ticket. This includes when there are multiple attachments in the email.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option to separate one attachment for one ticket.

h3. Why this is important
Give flexibility for admin to control how the issue creation via email.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Ability to create one issue per attachment that send via email

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, agents is allow to create and delete the organization. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Options to set a restriction for agents to delete organization. Only the administrator can do it.

h3. Why this is important
 To prevent from agents to delete the organization. Normally, a project have multiple of agents. It is best the organization deletion control by administrator.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Restrict agent from delete project organization

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an agent provides the link(directly from agent view) i.e : https://<instancename>.atlassian.net/browse/TEST-1234
If a JSD customer opens the link, previously he/she will be correctly redirected to the customer portal to view this issue, 
i.e. https://<instancename>.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/2/TEST-1234.

Currently, for the new JSD portal, the redirection becomes problematic that the JSD customer is only redirected to the customer portal page at https://<instancename>.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portals. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Agent provides the direct link from agent view to the reporter(customer)
# Customer hits the link 

h3. Expected Results
Should be redirected to the portal version of the issue

h3. Actual Results
Redirects to the customer portal instead

h3.Workaround
Provide the portal version of the URL instead: https://<instancename>.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/2/TEST-1234
fields.summary: Issue redirection in new portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement

When customers raise issues in portals, some of the fields are repeated accross all request types and are standard information that doesn't change. So the customer needs to fill in the same information for these field each time they raise a ticket. 

h3. Suggestion

Allow a way to create a template/pre-defined value by the customer for those fields. So that the customer can just have these values autofilled instead of having to enter the values each time.
fields.summary: Templates/pre-defined values for fields in customer portal

fields.description:
Currently, when issues are created via CSV import into a JSD project, they don't show the SLA values in issue view. They need to be recalculated via REST calls as mentioned in this article https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/missing-corrupted-sla-data-in-jira-service-desk-828790603.html.

The suggestion is to add this functionality in CSV import by default.
fields.summary: SLA should be automatically calculated in CSV import

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While configuring the automation if statement comment contains, there is a Case Sensitive checkbox, once it is selected it doesn't save as well as the automation only runs for tickets that match the exact word, ignoring the checkbox is selected or not.

h3. Environment

Jira Service Desk Automation.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Create an automation rule with the trigger comment added;
# Add an if statement of comment contains;
# Select the Case Sensitive checkbox and save it;
# Edit the if statement again.
{code}
When: comment added
If: Comment Contains
* Check Case sensitive checkbox
{code}

h3. Expected results

The automation rule is saved with the Case Sensitive checkbox checked and the rule only runs for tickets that match how the word was spelled in the automation.

h3. Actual result

The Case Sensitive checkbox remains unchecked and the automation only runs for tickets that matches how the word was spelled in the automation.
 !Screen Recording 2019-09-02 at 04.21 PM.gif! 

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Automation if statement "case sensitive" not working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-6219].
  {panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it is not possible to blacklist specific email addresses in a Service Desk project to prevent specific emails addresses from being sent customer notifications.

It can be a problem when Service Desk issues are created automatically by email by a monitoring system, and then the monitoring system gets spammed with notifications coming from the Service Desk issue.

Disabling all the customer notifications within the project is one way to workaround the situation, but it does not apply in the case where we want to add participants to these Service Desk issues and we want them to receive notifications (but not the monitoring system).


h3. Suggested Solution

Allow allows to blacklist specific email addresses for outgoing mail:
- either for the whole JIRA instance via the page ⚙ > System > Outgoing Mail
- or for a specific Service Desk
fields.summary: Ability to blacklist e-mail addresses for sending email messages (outgoing notifications)

fields.description:
Automation rules will throw a false alarm error, even when *Allow other rules to trigger this rule* is unticked.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create the following automation rule:
{code}WHEN: Comment Added
IF: Comment contains "update"
THEN: Alert user {code}
# Add a comment on a ticket, in order to trigger the automation.

h3. Expected Results

The automation is correctly executed.

h3. Actual Results
The automation will be executed, however, the automation log will show both success and the error: {color:red}Rule execution dropped due to loop detection. This error is caused by a rule causing itself to be called again (e.g. when 'comment added' then 'add comment'){color}.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
The error persists even if *Allow other rules to trigger this rule* is unticked.

h3.Workaround
None at the moment.
fields.summary: Loop detection error on automation, even when "Allow other rules to trigger this rule" is not ticked

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When the approval step is configured to {{all approvers}}, the ticket remains in the "waiting for my approval" even if the user has already approved/declined, but the others don't.

h3. Suggested resolution

Once the user approves/decline the ticket, it is removed from the "waiting for my approval" for that user.
fields.summary: Remove the ticket from "waiting for my approval" once the ticket is approved/declined

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Field values which are update by automation rules are re-updated by Create Issue post functions
h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In the Create Issue transition, add a post function to copy a field value from another field
# Add an automation rule which will update a field value based based on the field values when Issue created

h3. Expected Results
Automation rule actions are executed after the issue creation is complete
h3. Actual Results
Automation rule actions are overridden by Create Issue post functions
 
h3. Notes
It seems to be a race condition when Creation is not completed, the request is updated by the automation rule then back to the original values which is updated by the reporter.

h3. Workaround
Instead of using the trigger *Issue created*, use *Issue is in "first status" for 1m* instead which would give a brief period for the request to be completely created.
fields.summary: Automation rule actions is updated by the Create Issue post function values

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 When the preferred language is set to use the browser's language, customers notifications are ignoring this setting and defaulting to project's default language

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Service Desk project;
 # Set it's default language to Norwegian, add Swedish as an option;
 # Create a new customer, it's preferred language will be their browser's language;
 # Using a browser in Swedish, log in to the portal and create a new request

h3. Expected Results
 * Customer notification will be sent in Swedish

h3. Actual Results
 * Customer notification ignores browser language and defaults to Norwegian

h3. Notes
* The request language is correctly set to Swedish but the notification is sent in Norwegian

h3. Workaround
 * Have the customer change their preferred language to Swedish
fields.summary: Customer notifications are not using the customer's browser language and defaults to project default language

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira Service Desk current mail queue can be affected by database connection disruption causing the queue to fail to update the status of "Sent" mails. The mails then will be retried, resulting in duplicate emails received by users/customers.

h3. Steps to reproduce
N/A

h3. Workaround
No workaround is available.
fields.summary: Current mail queue could potentially causing duplicate notifications
